page.title: 01Montacute and Odcombe area
page.content: Our D block is dominated by the village of Odcombe, divided into Higher and Lower.{About 60%}of the population are{retired.}Part of Montacute village is included. Many {buildings}are of{Ham stone,}a hard, locally quarried rock. The area is mainly{elevated pastoral}and agricultural land crossed by narrow, often sunken lanes. Shopping in both villages is limited, with one small shop cum post office in Odcombe, though more in Montacute where many tourists come to visit the Elizabethan house.The majority of the population are employed outside the block. Most traffic is passing through to Yeovil, Ham Hill, Montacute, Stoke or West Coker. Although quietly rural, the air ia often noisy with helicopters from Westlands or jets from Rnas Yeovilton.
